Html:
Hi!
I'm getting the following error trying to execute the test #20 - readexcel5.php

15:48:51 Load workbook from Excel5 file
Fatal error: Maximum execution time of 30 seconds exceeded in /var/www/durr/lib/PHPExcel/Shared/OLERead.php on line 120

XLSX files works fine, but XLS don't.

What could be wrong?
Increase your PHP time limit and you might find it runs, though normally it should run in about 2 seconds on my develop machine

Hi Mark!

30s is more than enought to process something that runs in a few seconds... anyway... that didn't solved.
The server keeps busy for ever and ever!

I've tested the same code in 2 different servers. Works fine in one and nothing on the other: a Debian 2.6.32-5-686.
Both runs the latest apache and php...
And this is only with xls files. XLSX goes like a charm in both servers.

what kind of test do you think that I should do to collect more information about the problem?
phpinfo() details for each server would be a starting point, because that should also provide some details of the underlying library versions such as libiconv or mbstring settings

Hi Mark.
The first one is the server that XLS works and the second, obviously, don't.

PHP Version 5.3.15

The library is timing out very early on in the script, a few bytes into reading the OLE container information from the file, before even starting to parse the content; so whatever is slowing execution down is probably related to slow response to reading bytewise the file.

Without having looked too closely, you're running suhosin on the Debian... I don't know if that's causing the problem (there's not been many reports of suhosin issues, and they're generally related to file permissions) but it is a pretty big difference in configuration.

I've unistalled the suhosin (if it could be removed... hehehehe) and there's no difference. "Debugging", I've notice that the application is trying to get cells with index from zero to (minus) infinite. Strange, but explain why nothing is processed... could this be a bug in PHP?

Hi everyone....

This thread might already be closed, but i spent hours trying to solve a similar situation.

My development environment and production environment are identical, windows 8, 64 bits FastCGI (on IIS), PHP on MSVC9. Despite I was able to load and work on "xlsx" files with no problem, trying to load a "xls" file (Excel5 reader) ends on a infinte loop on the method "Read" of the class "PHPExcel_Shared_OLERead", located on the file "PHPExcel/Shared/OLERead.php".

At first, I noticed a negative value returned by the method "_GetInt4d" was causing an infinte loop on a "for" sentence, evaluating an incremental counter against a negative value. This lead me on the wrong path believing this might be a bit related problem (32 bits vs 64 bits), but after hours and hours searching for a clue, I decided to move forward and test it on another box, where it worked correctly. Seeking for a clue, found some differences between the PHP Configuration on the three boxes and searching on some of those differences get me to this post http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/discussions/261394

So, in conclusion, if you are experience a time out while loading "xls" files, whit a message like:
Fatal error: Maximum execution time of 15 seconds exceeded in xxxxxx\PHPExcel\Shared\OLERead.php on line 120
or a near line number.

Check for your "magic_quotes_runtime" configuration and set it to "Off".

I hope this would help someone, as this is a really good product and i was about to give up on using it.

By the way, I was running PHPExcel version 1.7.8
